com.neatnodes.utils

Class DataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.neatnodes.utils.DataSet

  • public class DataSet
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of input/output data representing a given function. A DataSet can be used to test Genomes for how well they implement the function it represents.
    Author:
    Sam Griffin

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataSet(java.lang.String pathToCSV)
      Creates a DataSet from the data in a CSV file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataSet

        public DataSet(java.lang.String pathToCSV)
        Creates a DataSet from the data in a CSV file. Each row is validated to make sure it contains values for all specified inputs and outputs. The expected format for a CSV file is as follows: 
         - There must be at least 1 input column and at least 1 output column
 - All input columns must come before all output columns
 - You can add an optional weight column as the last column
 - All rows must have numeric values for each header
 - All rows must align with the columns defined by the header row
        Parameters:
        pathToCSV - The path to the CSV file.

      • isWeighted

        public boolean isWeighted()
        Check whether the DataSet includes a weight column.
        Returns:
        True if the DataSet has a weight column.

      • getInputsForRow

        public java.lang.Double[] getInputsForRow(int rowNumber)
        Get the input values for a specific row. Returns null if the provided row number is invalid.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - The row to retrieve the inputs from. Rows are indexed starting from 0.
        Returns:
        The array of input values.

      • getOutputsForRow

        public java.lang.Double[] getOutputsForRow(int rowNumber)
        Get the output values for a specific row. Returns null if the provided row number is invalid.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - The row to retrieve the outputs from. Rows are indexed starting from 0.
        Returns:
        The array of output values.

      • getWeightForRow

        public java.lang.Double getWeightForRow(int rowNumber)
        Get the weight for a specific row. Returns null if the provided row number is invalid or if the DataSet does not have weights.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - The row to retrieve the weight from. Rows are indexed starting from 0.
        Returns:
        The weight.
